Articles.Content:
This is not about the largest spacestation, although that can be an awe factor. This is not about getting a certain type of space station to orbit by rocket.

This is Most Awesome Spacestation, exactly what it says on the tin. Use whatever mods you want [insta-orbit or OC Jumpdrive come to mind] to get what you consider to be the best possible looking spacestation into orbit.

A tip I'll give is that you can have larger stations if you build them in the spaceplane hangar.

My entry:

.Craft file:

http://www59.zippyshare.com/d/48626643/41726/Predator%20Station.craft

Edited September 5, 2012 by RedDwarfIV

Well, I don't like using insta-orbit and mods like that, so here's the best looking I've been able to get into space legitimately.

Even viewing this space station in orbit causes my computer to drop to 1 or 2 FPS

(Stands for Heat Shield-Rotational Artificial Gravity Station Mk2)
That is a nice station. looks like it has good crew capacity too.
where can i download the predator space station craft. file (save file).
Can you send me a link, to where i can download that mod? i can't find it my self :) :) :)
It uses NovaPunch, BACE pack, Crewtank, Truss Pack, Kosmos and Orbital Construction [it's far too massive for a normal launch vehicle, or for the pad.]

<img src="http://i558.photobucket.com/albums/ss24/darenton/SpaceStationAlpha2.png" alt="Space Station Alpha" width="1600" height="900" />

used Orbital construction to get it into orbit,

Edited September 7, 2012 by darenton2k7

used Orbital construction to get it into orbit,

<img src="https://photos-1.dropbox.com/thumb/AAAXxT3SpfVTiSrrRTyxdcDkFES98jkUkuDgmrTafO8acA/14788789/png/2048x1536/2/1346796000/0/2/Space%20Station%20Alpha2.png/yGNx_rkB_RC-jq92uBGB8a82r9Wfc-wgxX2_wvyWN-Y" alt="Space Station Alpha" width="1600" height="900" />

how much FPS do you get with that thing
Wow. That is massive.
Here is my personal favorite design:

The Alpha has the hugeness, but the DS-2 has my kind of 'awesome because it's cluttered' feel. Like my desk. The laptop sits on a pulled-out drawer, the scanner sits on the DVD player, and I have both a flatscreen TV and a CRT computer monitor for my desktop.
The screenshot for the alpha is not working for me, just gives me the little broken image symbol. Anybody else having this problem?
Same here maxed, and I want to see it
I did see it. It was really long, had about three main 'shafts', with BACE parts linking them, and all the solar panels at one end. But yes, the image is down now.

You need to put the .craft file up for download on that 'Predator' station. I have all those mod packs and I realize it isn't feasible without cheats or that Shipyard plugin. That doesn't stop it from being a pretty impressive looking design that I totally want floating around just to look at! Please good sir?

Ok, soon as I get my desktop running, I'll put it up. And its Orbital Construction, not Shipyard [unless they are the same thing] that I used.

EDIT: Uploaded the link on the first post.

Also note, I forgot to mention it requires Probodobodyne too.

Edited September 5, 2012 by RedDwarfIV
This is my entry. Thank goodness for Orbital Construction and jumpdrives...
Wow. Clutter-awesome factor raised.
I don't think I should post images of my space stations, they're ridiculously simple and are only built for me to have a reliable endgate for my new hyperdrive equipped rockets.
i downloaded the craft file but i dont have all the parts. where can i find those?

Kerbal Space Station #11, my first really sucessful space station, its 10 brothers failed in some aspects with only 2 successes, KSS #2 and KSS #11

KSS #2, smaller and no gravity boom, launched successfully, current status:lost in space, assumed swallowed by space Kraken

<a href="http://imgur.com/qQfH0"><img src="http://imgur.com/qQfH0.jpg" title="Hosted by imgur.com" alt="" /></a>

KSS #10, Sister Station to KSS #10, Launched Successfully, lost due due to unexplained effect on extension of the gravity boom, Gravity boom experienced separation anxiety and decided to fling itself back into the station Creating a serious debris problem,

<a href="http://imgur.com/kynah"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/kynah.png" alt="" title="Hosted by imgur.com" /></a>

Pilot Jeb survived to fly KSS #10

KSS #11

Launch Sucessful, effect of gravity Boom on Stabilisation - None, Status; Re-entered Atmo

<a href="http://imgur.com/6N50s"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/6N50s.jpg" alt="" title="Hosted by imgur.com" /></a>

<a href="http://imgur.com/AFHPr"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/AFHPr.jpg" title="Hosted by imgur.com" alt="" /></a>

<a href="http://imgur.com/TSNCn"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/TSNCn.png" title="Hosted by imgur.com" alt="" /></a>

<a href="http://imgur.com/o8ibs"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/o8ibs.png" alt="" title="Hosted by imgur.com" /></a>

<a href="http://imgur.com/COHXW"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/COHXW.jpg" title="Hosted by imgur.com" alt="" /></a>

Note for Future Development, Gravity Booms Do not Work

I don't think I should post images of my space stations, they're ridiculously simple and are only built for me to have a reliable endgate for my new hyperdrive equipped rockets.

A station is a station, simplicity does not matter!

On that note, my Aries Station at a LKO of 400km. 80% legitimately put into orbit. I say 80% because the frames were so bad that I couldn't manage the rendezvous on my crappy Mac CPU.
I really like the design, and that it was made by rendezvous 'docking' certainly is awesome. Very good work.
Blimey, that's incredible. I agree with Red Dwarf, the fact that you built it via rendezvous is pretty darn cool, not to mention tricky. Might I ask what mods the solar panels are from?
He said the large ones were Kosmos, but I don't know what the smaller ones are. I don't remember what pack the smaller ones are from, though I think it might be one of NovaSilisko's works.
